description: {"blocks":[{"key":"corvd","text":"Our foodborne Pathogen detection and tracking project main goal is to create openly available FAIR workflows capable of detecting and tracking all kinds of pathogens in any metagenomics sample, specifically in food serving public health purposes. To test our workflows, our first step was to create our test datasets. That are mainly food samples, which are spiked with particular strain of a pathogen and the workflows should detect it and tack its trace among all samples. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64ov1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7hupk","text":"The following steps will show you how our samples, as test datasets, are prepared","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: EOSC-Life: Digital Life Science Call for Academia-Industry Collaborations

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"41k9c","text":"Bacteria stock cultures Salmonella enterica subsp. Houtenae DSM 9221, Salmonella enterica subsp. Enterica DSM 554, Salmonella enterica subsp. Salamae DSM 9220, Campylobacter jejuni subsp. Jejuni DSM 4688, Campylobacter lari subsp. Lari DSM 11375, Listeria monocytogenes DSM 20600, Listeria monocytogenes DSM 19094 and Listeria ivanovii subsp. Ivanovii DSM 20750 have been used for sequencing the pure strains.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjb7u","text":"Salmonella have been grown on a XLD plate and enriched in buffered pepton water at   for  . Listeria have been grown on Brilliance ™ Listeria agar plate and enriched in half fraser broth at   for  . Campylobacter has been cultured on Brilliance CampyCount Agar, Campylobacter Selective Blood Free Agar (CCDA) plates and enriched in Preston selectiv bouillon at   for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":83,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":89,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":190,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":196,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":361,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":367,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2ufc6","text":"Salmonella have been used in spiked samples with chicken meat with and without enrichment. For the sequencing setups without enrichment bacteria from fluidic cultures have been used, 1 ml has been centrifuged and the pellet together with the meat was used for DNA isolation. In the enrichment step the spiked Salmonella samples were incubated at   for   before DNA isolation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":346,"length":1},{"key":7,"offset":352,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1a779","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"1F88D340166611EEB3E4D1CBF17A13F9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"225B5430166611EEB3E4D1CBF17A13F9","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"2717F1E0166611EEB3E4D1CBF17A13F9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"30","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":172800,"guid":"242C1C90166611EEB3E4D1CBF17A13F9","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"4":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"184D04C0166611EEB3E4D1CBF17A13F9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"42","unit":10}},"5":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"1A52E6E0166611EEB3E4D1CBF17A13F9","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"6":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"11DB3D00166611EEB3E4D1CBF17A13F9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"7":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"158CAC40166611EEB3E4D1CBF17A13F9","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fkc8q","text":"Training Material on the Galaxy Training Network (GTN)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"th34","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cg9oa","text":"Genomic DNA of the samples was extracted by using the STAR BEADS Pathogen DNA/RNA Extraction kit (CYANAGEN SRL, Bologna, Italy) a magnetic bead based nucleic acid extraction method. Samples have been incubated at   for   with lysis buffer and Proteinase K   followed by extraction according to the manufacturer‘s instructions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":213,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":219,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":256,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dm6dc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"ABBF2490166611EEB3E4D1CBF17A13F9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"56","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"C140F8C0166611EEB3E4D1CBF17A13F9","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"86803B10166611EEB3E4D1CBF17A13F9","id":0,"label":"/μl","scientificNotation":false,"unit":8}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"rh2j","text":"DNA concentrations were measured with the Qubit® 4.0 Fluorometer (Thermo Fisher Scientific) using the double-stranded DNA (dsDNA) High-Sensitivity (HS) assay kit (Thermo Fisher Scientific), following the manufacturer’s protocol. The quality was evaluated with a Nanodrop® 1000 (Themo Fisher Scientific), assessing the 260/280 nm and 260/230 nm ratios. 260/280 and 260/230 ratios were close to the expected ranges 1.8–2.0 and 2.0–2.2, respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a3gbo","text":"Nanopore sequencing was performed by Oxford Nanopore sequencing technology for genomic DNA by using the Native barcoding genomic DNA (with EXP-NBD104, EXP-NBD114, and SQK-LSK109) protocol (Oxford Nanopore). In the first step, DNA repair and end-preparation for the adapter ligation were performed. The NEBNext FFPE DNA Repair Mix (NEB) and NEBNext Ultra II End repair / dA-tailing Module (NEB) reagents were prepared according to the manufacturer‘s instructions. DNA tested samples were diluted with nuclease-free water according to the protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1hic5","text":"For R9.4.1 flow cells, transfer   (or 100-200 fmol) genomic DNA into a   Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube and adjusted to the volume of   with nuclease-free water in   Eppendorf DNA LoBind tubes, mixed thoroughly by flicking the tube (to avoid DNA fragmentation), and spun down.   of NEBNext FFPE DNA Repair Buffer,   of NEBNext FFPE DNA Repair Mix,   of Ultra II End-prep reaction buffer and   of Ultra II End-prep enzyme mix were combined. After gentle mixing by flicking the tube, it was spun down and incubated for 5 min at   following with incubation for   at   followed by the sample purification by using Agencourt AMPure XP beads (Beckman Coulter) was performed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":32,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":71,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":129,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":159,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":272,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":309,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":343,"length":1},{"key":7,"offset":386,"length":1},{"key":8,"offset":521,"length":1},{"key":9,"offset":553,"length":1},{"key":10,"offset":558,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"3F839823168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":4}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.5","duration":300,"error":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3F839AF7168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"65","unit":2}},"10":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3F8398BA168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"65","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"48","duration":300,"error":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3F839B7E168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"65","unit":1}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.5","duration":300,"error":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3F839C0A168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"65","unit":2}},"4":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"3.5","error":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3F839948168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"65","unit":1}},"5":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3F8399CE168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"65","unit":1}},"6":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"3.5","duration":300,"error":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3F839CA2168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"65","unit":1}},"7":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"3","duration":300,"error":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3F839D3F168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"65","unit":1}},"8":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"3","duration":300,"error":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3F839DD5168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"20","unit":10}},"9":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","duration":300,"error":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3F839A60168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"65","unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d3s61","text":"Agencourt AMPure XP beads were resuspended by vortexing, and the DNA sample was transferred into a   Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube. A total of   of resuspended beads were added, the sample was mixing by flicking the tube, and incubated on a Hula mixer for   at room temperature. For the washing step, 70% ethanol solution was freshly prepared by using nuclease free water. The sample was spun down and placed on a magnet unit until a pellet was formed and with the eluate clear and colorless. Although the tube is on a magnet unit, the supernatant was pipetted off, and the pellet was washed twice with   of freshly prepared 70% ethanol. After a brief spin down, the sample was placed on a magnetic unit, residual ethanol was pipetted off, and the pellet was dried for about  . Then the pellet was resuspended in   of nuclease-free water for   at room temperature, placed on a magnetic unit, and clear and colorless DNA sample was separated from the pellet. The DNA sample ( ) was quantified by using a Qubit 4 fluorometer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":257,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":843,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":99,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":139,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":252,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":599,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":771,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":809,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":838,"length":1},{"key":7,"offset":970,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d7h9e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.5","error":false,"guid":"4695A97F168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"60","error":false,"guid":"4695A9FC168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"60","duration":300,"error":false,"guid":"4695AA7B168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","duration":300,"error":false,"guid":"4695AB0D168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"unit":1}},"4":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","duration":30,"error":false,"guid":"4695AB90168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"unit":1}},"5":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","duration":30,"error":false,"guid":"4695AC12168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"unit":1}},"6":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","duration":120,"error":false,"guid":"4695AC96168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"unit":1}},"7":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"4695A8F5168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9vfoa","text":"The repaired and end-prepped DNA was taken forward into the native barcode ligation step. 500 ng of the end-prepped DNA was combined with Native Barcode   and NEB Blunt/TA Ligase Master Mix   and incubated for   at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":215,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":153,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":190,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":210,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8fshl","text":"Then, the sample purification by using Agencourt AMPure XP beads (Beckman Coulter) was performed as described before. The pellet was resuspended in   of nuclease-free water. The DNA sample ( ) was quantified by using a Qubit 4 fluorometer. Equimolar amounts of each barcoded sample was pooled into a   Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube, ensuring that sufficient sample is combined to produce a pooled sample of   total for the R9.4.1 flow cell. The pooled and barcoded DNA was quantified by the Qubit fluorometer and continued with the adapter ligation and clean-up step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":148,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":190,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":300,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":403,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"elogs","text":"AMII adapter mix (OxfordNanopore) and Quick T4 Ligase (NEB) were spun down and placed on ice. The ligation buffer (LNB, Oxford Nanopore), elution buffer (EB, Oxford-Nanopore), and long fragment buffer (LFB, Oxford Nanopore) was thawed at room temperature, spun down, and mixed by pipetting.   pooled barcoded sample ( ) was combined with Adapter Mix II (AMII)  , NEBNext Quick Ligation Reaction Buffer (5X)   and Quick T4 DNA Ligase  , gently mixed by pipetting, spun down, and incubated for   at room temperature. The mixture was purified by using AMPure XP beads;   of resuspended beads were added to the DNA sample, mixed by pipetting and incubated for   on a Hula mixer at room temperature, then spun down and placed on a magnet unit. After pellet formation, the supernatant was pipetted off. The pellet was washed with   of LFB, then the beads were resuspended by pipetting and placed on a magnet for a pellet formation. A clear and colorless supernatant was removed and the washing procedure was repeated. After the second washing with LFB, the sample was dried for  , resuspended in   of EB and incubated for   at room temperature. Then the sample was placed on a magnetic unit to form a pellet until the supernatant is clear and colorless. A total of   of the sample were retained in a   DNA LoBind tube and 1 μL was quantified by using a Qubit 4 fluorometer. The prepared DNA library was then stored on ice until it was loaded into a flow cell.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":237,"length":17},{"style":"bold","offset":497,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":677,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":1121,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[{"key":7,"offset":291,"length":1},{"key":8,"offset":317,"length":1},{"key":9,"offset":360,"length":1},{"key":10,"offset":407,"length":1},{"key":11,"offset":433,"length":1},{"key":12,"offset":492,"length":1},{"key":13,"offset":566,"length":1},{"key":14,"offset":656,"length":1},{"key":15,"offset":824,"length":1},{"key":16,"offset":1072,"length":1},{"key":17,"offset":1090,"length":1},{"key":18,"offset":1116,"length":1},{"key":19,"offset":1259,"length":1},{"key":20,"offset":1294,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2.5","duration":600,"error":false,"guid":"4CD5F53F168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","duration":600,"error":false,"guid":"4CD5F5BE168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"unit":1}},"10":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","duration":300,"error":false,"guid":"4CD5F869168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"unit":1}},"11":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"4CD5F136168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"12":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","duration":600,"error":false,"guid":"4CD5F1AA168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"unit":1}},"13":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","duration":600,"error":false,"guid":"4CD5F63A168911EEAE420A58A9FE CD5EFDB168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"4":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","duration":30,"error":false,"guid":"4CD5F96B168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"unit":1}},"5":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.5","duration":600,"error":false,"guid":"4CD5F441168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"unit":2}},"6":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"700","error":false,"guid":"4CD5F053168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":8}},"7":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"700","duration":600,"error":false,"guid":"4CD5F4BE168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"unit":8}},"8":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"65","duration":600,"error":false,"guid":"4CD5F6D0168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"unit":1}},"9":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"4CD5F0C6168911EEAE420A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ba7is","text":"For the flow cell loading procedure, the sequencing buffer (SQB), loading beads (LB), flush tether (FLT), and flush buffer (FB) all from OxfordNanopore, were thawed at room temperature and placed on ice. SQB, FB, and FLT were mixed by vortexing and spun down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":168,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e4pq0","text":"To prepare the flow cell priming mix,   of thawed and mixed Flush Tether (FLT) was mixed directly to the tube of thawed and mixed Flush Buffer (FB).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":38,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8369j","text":"The priming port was opened and check for a small air bubble under the cover by drawing back a small volume to remove any bubbles. 800 μl of the priming mix was added into the flow cell via the priming port, avoiding the introduction of air bubbles and incubated for  . During this time, prepare the library for loading by following the steps below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":267,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6q1uk","text":"For the preparation of the library for loading   Sequencing Buffer II (SBII) was mixed","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":47,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ddo40","text":"with   Loading Solution (LS) and   DNA library in a total volume of  . For completing the flow cell priming the SpotON sample port was opened as well and   of the priming mix was loaded into the flow cell via the priming port, avoiding the introduction of air bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":5,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":33,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":68,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":154,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"13fn","text":"The DNA library was loaded directly after this step on a R9.4.1 MinION Mk flow cell (OxfordNanopore). SpotON sample port cover and priming port were closed and sequencing was started. The sequencing device control, data acquisition and real-time basecalling were carried out by the MinKNOW software the MinION Mk1C device.
